intro: Kageneckia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kageneckia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
